meanings.definition: A strong-smelling pungent-tasting bulb, used as a flavoring in cooking and in herbal medicine.
meanings.sent1: I added garlic to the pasta sauce for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: My mom always uses garlic when she cooks spaghetti.
meanings.sent3: The garlic bulb rolled off the kitchen counter and made a run for it.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as sharp and pungent as garlic, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The smell of garlic lingered in the kitchen long after dinner was over.

meanings.definition: A plant of the onion family with long, flat leaves and rounded bulbs.
meanings.sent1: The garlic plant in the garden is growing well this season.
meanings.sent2: Farmers harvest garlic in the fall to sell at the market.
meanings.sent3: The garlic plant whispered secrets to the neighboring vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The garlic plant stood tall in the field, a symbol of resilience.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green leaves of the garlic plant swayed in the breeze.
